alert.note: Alert for Dauphin; Lancaster; Lebanon; York (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued August 08 at 1:03PM EDT until August 09 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heat index values between 100 to 104 degrees expected. * WHERE...Lebanon, Dauphin, York and Lancaster Counties. * WHEN...Until 8 PM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity will increase the risk of heat related illnesses. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Maximum heat index values are forecast to occur Monday and Tuesday afternoon. Low temperatures in the mid 70s Monday night will not provide much relief from the heat.
info.instruction: Excessive Heat can be life-threatening among at-risk populations, such as children, the elderly, and those with pre-existing health conditions. Drink plenty of fluids, stay out of the sun, and stay in an air-conditioned room. Check up on relatives and neighbors, and provide pets with adequate water and shelter from the sun. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. LOOK BEFORE YOU LOCK. If you work or spend time outside, reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing. For excessive heat safety information, visit weather.gov/heat.
